article.headline: San Francisco 71, Santa Clara 68
article.story: SANTA CLARA, Calif. -- Dior Lowhorn scored 28 points and Angelo Caloiaro added 20 as San Francisco earned a 71-68 overtime victory against Santa Clara on Saturday. Blake Wallace had 12 points for the Dons (12-15, 7-5 West Coast Conference), making 4 of 5 3-point shots, including one in overtime. Marc Trasolini led Santa Clara (11-18, 3-9) with 17 points, and Ben Dowdell had 13, Michael Santos 11 and Troy Payne 10. USF, which led by as many as 16 points in regulation, won for the fifth time in six games. The Dons shot 12 of 19 (63.2 percent) from 3-point range, and beat Santa Clara for just the second time in 10 meetings.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
